35331926.review:
I used to love this game as a kid, it was so much fun. Is it as good as I remember? Well, no. Is it still fun? Yes.

It's a simple enough game. Eat smaller fish, grow bigger, eat the previously bigger but now smaller fish. I finished the game in about 8 hours, however I did take a lot of breaks inbetween levels to go do other stuff. And while I did lose all my lives, I didn't lose all my continues. By the time I got to the last level I was on my last continue. However, this isn't really because the game is super challenging, so to say.

One of the main flaws with this game for me is that it's pretty frustrating, and rather unfair at times. When you have a screen that's zoomed in on your big fish it's kind of hard to tell what's around you. One wrong move and you end up in the mouth of a giant fish you had no clue was even there, and by the time you see it it's too late. While this issue isn't present in the whole game, it's still there, making it so you can lose your lives in pretty unfair ways late in the game. 

The story is simple and kid-friendly, and if you're just looking for a little bit of fun for a couple of hours, then go ahead and pick this up I guess. However, I'm not sure that this game will click with everybody. I grew up playing these kinds of Popcap games on my dad's computer. Playing this is like getting slapped in the face with a nostalgia fish.

I've also bought this game at least 3 times by now, I think. I have honestly lost count, because I always lost those codes Popcap would give you when buying it from them. Definitely a lot easier when doing it on Steam! 

Now, would I recommend this game? I'm not sure, to be completely honest, as I'm writing this. You've probably already seen whether or not that thumb is pointing up and down. Even though I did enjoy it, I'm not sure if most people who didn't grow up playing this and the original would, which is why I can't say I recommend it.

However, if you think this game looks fun and you think you'd enjoy it, then go ahead and try it out. It doesn't cost a lot, so it's not like you have a whole lot to lose.

34658548.review:

34499152.review:
吞食鱼2，是由宝开出品的一款休闲小游戏，核心玩法就是大鱼吃小鱼，不断进化。在海底世界里，萌萌哒的鱼儿们游曳在水中，然而物竞天择适者生存，食物链的存在让这里也不再和平。玩家要做的就是控制自己的鱼儿，吞出一片新天地。

基本模式有闯关和限时两种，玩家的目标是挑战越来越高的分数。点击鼠标左键冲刺，右键释放天赋技能。移动鼠标即可将碰触到的鱼儿吞入腹中，如果不小心遇到比自己更大只的鱼儿，当然也是免不了被吃的结果。

除了吞吃鱼儿之外，还可以吃各种道具，道具的作用不一，大致都是提供一些增益效果。海底的蚌会产生一些珍珠，在蚌壳闭合之前吃掉珍珠会有惊喜，如果被蚌壳夹到则会损失一条生命，生命数消耗完毕则游戏结束，续命次数也消耗完毕则只能开始新游戏。

画面很卡通，感觉更适合在手机上玩，不过闲来无事点一会也很放松。宝开的经典作品之一，适合重温。

32662932.review: This game is just so good, and so addicting. I used to play this game all the time as a kid. I was scared of it the first time I played it, but it soon became my favorite game to play, along with Diner Dash and Wedding Dash. I'm so glad they brought this game to Steam and that I am able to play the game again. I hope one day they will bring the first Feeding Frenzy, as well as some other older games. I definitely would recommend this game to anyone. Even if you beat it really quickly it's still fun to play again. It takes about 2 hours to beat the game on average. It can be a little too easy sometimes, but it makes up for it in some other levels. You can wind up losing about 20 lives all in one level, expecially ones with poison minnows and mines. This game isn't widely popular, but it's a great game and deserves much more appreciation. Even if it's geared more towards kids, I think anyone can enjoy this game. I felt the need to write a review about this game just because I love it so much. I really hope to see more of these older games come to steam some day.

30925237.review:
I put a good dozen hours into Feeding Frenzy on XBLA and enjoyed what it offered. Feeding Frenzy 2, in contrast, disappoints. The gameplay itself takes the first game and builds on it with bits like the various power ups, doing surface jumps for bugs, and so on. But playing this on PC isn't fun; movement is consigned entirely to the mouse with no controller support or mapping, and the game is locked in a 4:3 resolution.

This isn't surprising considering FF2D is an 11 year old title with no support from PopCap. Nor is it surprising that it is all but forgotten about except for the occasional burst of nostalgia of mid 00s pc gaming.

Gets points for working just fine from the get-go on Win 10 for me, but no controller or resolution alternatives means no recommendation of this game. Better to find a console version.

29699222.review:
I have lots of memories of this game (and the first one) from my childhood. I don't want to spoil anything about the plot but I will say it's probably not what you'll expect.

PROS:
Perfect difficulty level for almost everyone, from kids to adults. Not too easy, but not too hard, although it gets harder as you progress.
Better graphics and sound than the first one (not that the first one was bad, it's just older)
Added mechanics like jumping out of the water to eat bugs and do flips
Doesn't take up too much memory

CONS: Replay value admittedly isn't super high. There's no achievements or anything like that. I used to play it for hours when I was a kid, though.
...That's about it. I think it's pretty quality for what it is. That being said, I do recommend waiting for it to go on sale.

29081384.review:
大鱼吃小鱼2，目前我补票的游戏中最久远的游戏，同时，纪念以前的Popcap。

游戏很简单，用鼠标操控角色吃掉小鱼成长，长大后吃掉更大的鱼，当进度条满值后过关，如果在这关全程没死，将会有特殊奖励；一共有3个阶段，死亡时此阶段重来。
游戏模式分为两个：普通游玩（故事模式）和限时挑战，普通游玩有命数，当命数全掉完后，系统会要求你续关（有三次续关的机会）；限时挑战里命数是无限的但会有时间限制，时间结束后也会要求你续关。
虽然游戏难度不是太大，而且可以选关，但你可以挑战下不续关，一口气通全部关卡。（限时挑战里，45关以后的关卡哪一关死太多次都容易崩盘，boss战虽然相对容易但也是如此）
https://www.bilibili.com/video/av11848771/
画风，场景，音乐在当时（2006年发售，我第一次玩的时候是2010年）都很出色。

我记得当时我很憧憬大鱼吃小鱼3的，但是等了好久，三代都没有出来；后来我才知道，原来Popcap被EA收购后，一直做植物大战僵尸有关的游戏而忘记了以前其他优秀的IP……虽然Popcap忘记了这游戏，但我们玩家是不会忘记的。
另外，本来想也把一代入手，但一代在steam上没有，只好收藏了一代的资源，有空也会打一下的。

虽然年代久远但还可以玩玩看的~

28354698.review:
Very fun game! A little repetitive but they throw in new items and fish as you progess to keep it interesting. The goal is to eat smaller fish while avoiding bigger fish until you are big enough to eat them as well. The ultimate goal is to keep doing this with various fish to discover this mysterious predator that has been lurking by the entire game.

Overall the game is fun, a little addictive and somewhat replayable. The campaign is a little short but long enough to make it fun and the difficulty ranges from very easy at the beginning to a decent challenge towards the end. However, if you lose all your lives, you can restart from the same level, so it is more of a casual game where staying alive for many levels only really affects your high score. When I was young it was one of my favourite games so I highly recommend it for younger players and mildly recommend it to others to kill some time, otherwize they might blow through the game quickly and be bored. But at such a low cost, overall it is a good game!

14766213.review:
Feeding Frenzy is a quite fun game, but also surprisingly challenging as the levels go on. As a small fish, you start out eating anything smaller than yourself, until you grow big enough to eat bigger fish. A simple enough concept, but difficult with the bigger fish trying to eat you while you try to even get to their size category.

Though it is a relatively old game, and the levels are pretty much the same, just with increasing difficulty, Feeding Frenzy has that element about it which makes it challenging and worth playing several times. I will come back to it once I finished a couple of other games.

so good . ★★★★☆☆
Bird Week の魚版。

ストアーの紹介ページでは想像できないほど、普通に面白い。
隠れた良作、シンプル・ザ・ベストゲームです。
英語表記ですがルールがシンプルなので、わからなくても大丈夫です。
操作はマウスだけで、いろんなアクションができます。

内容は、魚類を操って天敵を避けながら小魚を食べて大きくしていくゲームです。
小魚をある程度たべると大きくなり、今までのうざかった大魚を無双で食い荒らせれます。
ノーミスクリアーすると人魚が出ますのでおもいっきり噛み付きましょう。
そしてステージを進むごとに別の魚類を操ることが可能になります。
ＢＯＳＳもでます。はっきりいって弱いです。
後半のステージは難しいので慎重に食べないと、巨大魚にすぐ食べられちゃいますし、
爆弾やら、毒魚やら、鳥やら、イカスミやら邪魔物がいっぱいです。
最後に、スコアーやタイムを競ったりできるのでやりこみ要素としては十分です。
おすすめ。



※昔に、どこかの無料ゲームで同じの遊んだ記憶が・・・。。

11523366.review:
Everyone has their place on the food chain. It's a static reference to our predators and prey, dictating the creatures we're able to dominate, and those we would be better off avoiding. Sitting on the top of the chain, we as humans need not worry about being spontaneously eaten while simply out on a morning walk, but for the aquatic dwellers in Feeding Frenzy 2 it's a constant race to eat or be eaten, with a constantly evolving menu as every fish fills its belly and inflates itself in order to devour more and more. Morbid stuff for a casual game.

Feeding Frenzy 2 essentially works on the basis that there's always a bigger fish, and you want to be it. Gameplay is almost suffocatingly simple, boiling down to "eat what's smaller than you; avoid what's bigger" with the only change coming when you eat enough of the smaller fish that you're no longer one of them, and can then swim around chomping on everything that moves. It's basic, though undeniably enjoyable for what it is. Levels aren't particularly well balanced, and the lack of widescreen support (which means you are forced to play in a very narrow field of view) makes most deaths seem unfair, but otherwise it's a perfectly solid casual experience (if far less rewarding than I remember it being almost a decade ago upon release).

Budget priced and good for a few hours, I can recommend Feeding Frenzy 2 provided you are OK with playing what is ultimately little more than a mouse exercise. I doesn't hold up under extended play sessions, but for a few minutes a day it's a cute lesson on meaningless homicide, with some subliminal racist undertones to boot. What's not to love?

11471764.review:
물고기가 되어 자기보다 작은 크기의 물고기를 먹으며 커가는 게임이다. 고전 중의 고전으로, 꼭 이 게임이 아니더라도 각종 플래시 게임 등으로 해봤을 방식이다. Casual 게임의 명가답게 깔끔한 그래픽과 명확히 알 수 있는 인터페이스로 별 어려움 없이 게임의 원리를 이해할 수 있도록 했다. 빠르게 헤엄치는 기술을 통해서 좀 더 빠른 플레이를 도모할 수 있다.

 여러 스테이지가 있고 스테이지 별로 묶음이 있어 적당히 하다보면 주인공 물고기도 바뀌는 등 시각적으로 변화를 주려 노력했다. 하지만 간혹 등장하는 몇몇 특이 스테이지를 제외하고는 대부분 반복적인 플레이가 진행되기 때문에 지루해지기 쉽다. 가끔 심심할 때 하면 재미있을 것 같다.

10017400.review:
Friss kleine Fische wärend du versuchst nicht gefressen zu werden, wachse und friss ein kleinnes bisschen größere Fische wärend du versuchst nicht von großen Fischen gefressen zu werden, werde noch ein bisschen größer und [b] dominire die gottverdammte See und zeige den blöden Tunfischen wer der wahre Gott der Meere ist [/b] - bis ein Tiegerhai auftaucht und dich im Stück runterschluckt.... So viel dazu.
Das ganze Spiel handelt nur von Fischen. Fische, Fische, Fische, Fische - Fressen, Fressen, Fressen, Fressen.
Was auf den ersten Blick ziemlich eintönig wirkt, ist auch auf den zweiten Blick langweilig, aber es ist eine nette Zeitverschwendung, wenn man keine Lust hat, sich in irgendeiner Weise beim Spielen an zu strengen - und auch sonst auf repititive Vorgehensweisen steht. Es gibt eine sehr oberflächliche Story, welche als Begründung für die Reise her halten muss und alle Paar Level einen neuen 'Hauptprotagonisten'-Fisch, welcher sich durch Horden von ab und an wechsenden aquatisch lebenden Wirbeltieren mampft. Gespickt ist das ganze mit ab und an auftauchenden Bonus-Leveln welche ihren Zweck, die eintönigkeit zu vertreiben, einfach nicht erfüllen können. Trotzdem ist die Idee ganz süß, die verschiedenen Orte nett dargestellt und mit einer passenden Musik hinterlegt. Die Powerups sind interessant verteilt und wenn man mal 10 Minuten nichts zu tun hat (und das Spiel so wie so aus dem Humblebundle hat), kann man ruhig eine Runde auf die Jagt nach anderen Kiementrägern gehen. Aber halt nur eine Runde.
4/10 would play again.

9984110.review: This is an extremely fun game.  Anyone who enjoyed the first stage of Spore where you were a little creature trying to eat small things and grow while avoiding things bigger than you should check this out.  There is enough variety across the 60 levels to keep things interesting.  You get to play as several different kinds of fish and prey on a variety of different fish as well.  There are powerups and obstacles that come and go.  There are some fun boss battles (against the same enemy as different fish.)  There is a decent, casual level of challenge, with one of the levels toward the end being rather challenging.  There is a nice surprise after you beat the game, and for some added replayability and challenge, there is a time attack mode.

9825932.review:
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
  (Redirected from Feeding Frenzy 2)
Feeding Frenzy 2
Feedingfrenzy2cover.jpg
Developer(s) 	Sprout Games
Publisher(s) 	PopCap Games
Designer(s) 	Ed Allard and Ben Lyon
Series 	Feeding Frenzy
Platform(s) 	Microsoft Windows, Xbox 360 (XBLA), PlayStation 3 (PSN), Android
Release date(s) 	PC (February 6, 2006)
XBLA (September 17, 2008)[1]
PSN (March 11, 2010)
Genre(s) 	Arcade
Mode(s) 	Single player, Multiplayer (XBLA, PSN)
Distribution 	CD, Online download

Feeding Frenzy 2: Shipwreck Showdown is an arcade-style video game involving the marine food chain. It is also the sequel to the 2004 title, Feeding Frenzy. The game was developed and published by PopCap Games.

Contents

    1 Gameplay
    2 Plot
        2.1 Special abilities
        2.2 Power-ups
        2.3 Environments
            2.3.1 Above water challenges
            2.3.2 Midnight Zone
        2.4 Playable characters
    3 References
    4 External links

Gameplay

As in Feeding Frenzy, players have to control several fast growing marine predators who are out to uncover a mystery which is lurking in the ocean. The aim of the game is to avoid predators and obstacles while eating other smaller fish and creatures, eventually reaching the top of the food chain. Feeding Frenzy 2 includes 60 new levels which feature scenery such as new underwater worlds, coral reefs, deep sea caves, and sunken ships, as well as above water challenges. The story mode starts the player as a small butterfly fish named Boris. The player has to eat and chomp his or her way to the top of the food chain. Along the way, the player meets new creatures, both friendly and unfriendly.
Plot

The player controls different fishes. We start first as Boris the butterfly fish. In the end of each the 9th stage, the fish saw a dark shadow. After moving on and moving on until we reach Goliath the shark, Goliath reached the top of the food chain and battles the Intruder. He lured the Intruder to a nearby mine. When the INTRUDER explodes the mine, it stays stunned and we have to eat enough shrink shroom to attack the intruder. After defeating the INTRUDER, the alien fish shrunk and escaped, so we have to re-control the fish in the previous food chain to track down the Intruder. The stages after the first boss battle got more difficult, and each fish that we re-control have 3 stages only. However this is an exception to Edie the Angler Fish as the Intruder was said to be afraid of the dark. After we reach the last stage, Boris battles the Intruder in an ocean full of cuttlefish and poison fishes. After shrinking the Intruder for one last time, the Intruder was eaten by Boris.
Special abilities

The animals which the player controls have special abilities, although these are generally quite similar to those in the previous title. They include a "dash" maneuver for a quick burst of speed, the ability to "suck up" a large school of fish all at once, as well as an ability which allows the character Edie to light up her way.
Power-ups

The game features power-ups which can be used to gain instantaneous or short term effects. These include older power-ups from the previous game, as well as completely new ones:

    Lighting Bolt: A lightning bolt icon which is usually stored in a bubble. The effect of this power-up is to provide increased swimming speed.
    Shrink Shroom: The effect of this power-up is to shrink any fish whose size is bigger than the player.
    Instant Illuminate: Lights up the whole screen for a few moments during the "Midnight Zones".
    Looney Lures: This power-up is displayed as a hook icon. It lures and moves bigger fish off of the screen.
    1UP: The player is awarded an extra life.
    Golden Herring: This fish makes the player grow one level size, allowing you to eat the next biggest fish. This fish is fast though, and the best method of catching it is to use the inhale ability.
    Plankton: Can be eaten by Edie for light in midnight zones.

Environments
Above water challenges

In some levels the player will be able to jump out of the water, catching several insects and bugs which wander near the surface. In the air, the player can use an ability which sucks a number of insects at the same time. The player can also do back flips to gain more style points, while a failed attempt will result in a belly flop. Also some are just in the middle waters of the ocean and are like midnights zones, only the giant difference is it has light.
Midnight Zone

The player will also come across several “Midnight Zones”. During these levels Edie the anglerfish's illuminating lure will be used to light the player’s way. However, eventually the power of her illuminating lure will decrease. Hence, Edie has to hunt for bioluminescent plankton to increase the lighted area of the level. A bulb icon power-up can be eaten for instant full screen illumination.
Playable characters

    Boris - Boris the butterfly fish is the first playable character in the game. He lives in the warm waters of the Sandy Shoal, a beautiful area off the Frenzy Coast. He is the first to meet oysters that give pearls and sometimes power ups, and also meets starfish and sharks.

    Layla - Layla the queen triggerfish is the second playable character in the game. She lives in the warm water of Paradise Reef and is the first to meet barracuda enemies and shrink shrooms.

    Edie - Edie the anglerfish is the third playable character. Edie's levels are difficult because her several of levels are the "Midnight Zones". Note that the fish's gender has been changed to female due to the fact that only female angler fish emit light; this was a mistake in the original game. She is the only returning playable character from the first game.

    Peter - Peter the pompano is the fourth playable character in the game. He lives in Buccaneer Bay, where the player will first come across cuttlefish, which shoot ink.

    Harry - Harry the humphead wrasse is the fifth playable character in the game, the balloons are back after a while and you can again jump for bonuses out of the water. Also, he meets pelicans.

    Goliath - Goliath the great white shark is the sixth playable character in the game. He is very high up in the food chain, and is the first to fight "The Intruder".

    The Intruder - The Intruder is an alien fish disrupting the food chain. The player is required to fight it every 3 levels after Goliath defeats it for the first time. The player then moves lower down the food chain, playing as previous characters until The Intruder is defeated for the last time, after which Boris eats it. This completes the game. The Intruder is then unlocked as a playable character, and the player can then play through the entire game again as The Intruder.

References

    http://www.xbox.com/en-US/games/f/ffrenzy2xboxlivearcade/

    Feeding Frenzy 2 Official site
    Feeding Frenzy 2 at MobyGames

9654321.review: FF2D is a fun casual game for all ages.  You control a fish that needs to eat smaller fish, and avoid bigger fish.  The more fish you eat, the bigger you get. I can't imagine playing it for hours on end though.

9617113.review: Да,да,да!Игра цепляет просто жуть,несмотря на незамысловатый сюжет и мульт графон!Вторая часть лучше чем первая в плане заморочек с бонусами и локациями.Оторваться от игры очень тяжело,хотя она и не настолько сложная ))).Однозначно несколько часов позитива обеспечено,аркадный пожиратель рыбок с управлением одной мышью.10 из 10, маст хэв бро )))

9497201.review: Feeding Frenzy – одна из моих самых любимых игр! Это казуальный шедевр, царь в аркадном мире.  Было множество версий и частей этой игры, жаль в стим добралась только одна часть, но и это уже хорошо. Множество ярких и разных уровней, продвижение по (боюсь громко скажу) сюжету и уйма радости. Помню как спускал деньги в игровой автомат с этой игрой, а тут вам дают шанс взять ее за скромные деньги. Я очень советую взять эту игру на скидках и потратить 3 часа на прохождение.

9491872.review:
I too got this game for nostalgia purposes. However, it has not aged well, at all. The first problem is the game's resolution. I know this game is pretty old, and super HD things weren't around back then, but the view you're given is so very very limited. There is no warning of any predators that are coming from off screen. Far too often you will find yourself swimming right into a fish. Another issue is that the game is crazy unfair. Most of the power-downs that prey emit are pretty much death sentences. Fighting the alien fish (5 times with no difference in the fight every 2 levels...) or a barracuda is pretty much impossible because they just turn around and eat you right away. Another big issue is your growth rate. You have to eat an insane number of fish before growing to the next level. This is hindered even more due to the fact you lose all of your growth bar for that level once you die. Finally, the concept of the game itself is pretty flawed as well. The game's level difficulty is reversed: it is easier at the end of the level than at the start. This makes the feeling of completing a level a chore rather than a rewarding experience. 

Overall, skip this even if you've played it back in the day. It is not at all worth $10. $5 is a decent price, but only if you've played it before and are prepared to rage often.

9385040.review:
マウスと左クリックの高速移動で魚を動かし、自分より大きい魚に食べられないようにしながら、（自分より）小さい魚を食べて続けどんどん大きくしていき、形勢逆転していく、いわゆる「食物連鎖ゲーム」。
（ちなみにゲームが進むと右クリックで近くの魚などを吸い込む特殊能力が使える。）

ペグルやビジュエルド等のPopCapらしくルールがシンプルかつ空いた時間に手軽に遊べ、ゲームを止めてもゲーム終了直前のところから再開できるところが個人的に良い。

ただ、このSteam版は言語が英語のみなので、Xbox360日本語版にあった「ガブッ」がないのは少し残念、、
（まぁ、ルール自体はシンプルなので英語があまりわからなくても十分遊べるのが救いだが、、）

9374669.review:
挺优秀的一款休闲游戏，很久之前沉迷过一段时间，今天又通关了一遍，就趁现在写点东西吧。
游戏的画风和音乐都不错，游戏中的鱼也是各有特色（不过怎么看还是觉得主角鱼比较好看），基本规则当然是“大鱼吃小鱼”了，你要通过不断的吞食成长，成为海洋食物链顶层的生物！游戏难度不会太高，当然想要玩好还是得有一定技巧的，你可以利用各种道具和大鱼躲猫猫、斗智斗勇·，甚至趁其不备一口将几秒前还威风凛凛的大鱼吞掉！
游戏的场景不少，热带浅海，深海，沉船累累的海底、甚至是人类在海底的研究设施，你扮演的鱼也可以跃出水面，将飞行的虫子也变成自己的盘中餐。跳出水面这个设定，也算是相对一代而言的进步了吧。
游戏的剧情很简单，就如标题所言与神秘物种展开的决战(怎么有种地球人大战外星人的感觉)。最后是小鱼拯救了海洋！最后二周目有惊喜！
另外，游戏里面还有各种鱼类的科普知识，算是个小福利了。游戏的流程也不长，两个多少时就可以完成了。游戏的模式只有两个，故事模式和时间竞赛，不过玩久了比较容易会枯燥。没有成就系统或卡片也是个遗憾。尽管如此，在闲暇时拿出来玩两把打发时间还是个不错的选择。

9368486.review:
The game in itself is quite good. It has a lot of levels and doesn't give you a lot of lives. There are mini stages that break the pace of the game and that's a good thing. 

However be warned that the male voice that will constantly shout "frenzy!" at you is quite unpleasant. Game best played with the sound off I suppose ^^.

9367277.review: A true classic, from my days on the school computer, to now. It is still a game worth playing and owning. This game not only shows you the struggle to the top, but also provides little facts between levels about the aquatic kingdom. I will admit it is a little annoying when two fish corner you, and then the Shark or whatever is the dangerous fish of the level comes in for the easy kill. I'd give it a solid 3.5/5-4/5 stars, because I don't seem to see a way to save in story mode, and story mode is too long for me not to want a break.

9018486.review:
This is one of the most engaging titles I have played in recent years. Feeding Frenzy 2: Shipwreck Showdown Deluxe™ is one of the last old-school classics, and every modern game should try to learn from the greatness of this title.

From the astounding, vivid, almost LIFELIKE visuals which really capture the feeling of a deep sea aquatic adventure, to the dynamic, orchestral soundtrack which supplements the gameplay extremely well; this game is as close to perfection as one can get. But Feeding Frenzy 2: Shipwreck Showdown Deluxe™ is more than a game; it is a critique towards the human condition in the 21st Century. The world order in Feeding Frenzy 2: Shipwreck Showdown Deluxe™ is eat, or be eaten; much like it is in our society. 

Personally, I think this game should be remastered with modern technology, to give the developers the possibility to fully realize their vision for this groundbreaking game, which was not possible at the time of it´s release. Just imagine this: Feeding Frenzy 3. With even better visuals, Oculus Rift Support, and a multiplayer to fully capture the Online market. I have a dream. And this dream is Feeding Frenzy.

5440824.review: I loved this game when I was 10, I love it now. Such a good time-killer =P

378588.review:
All Pop Cap's games are just perfect. Easy to learn, "plug & play" but, with increasing difficulty and clear instructions before every new thing to learn. Intense rythm, you are always clicking the mouse, no time to rest. Original, they can be based on anything else but they do their own way and with outstanding imagination. The right difficulty at the right time, to maintain the interest. Variated play modes. Ridiculous simple controls, usually just the mouse and their two buttons, some times the arrows pad is also neeced but, that's all. Very good music and sound effects....
Well, if you already played Zuma, you know what I mean but, they have other interesting titles and this is one of them.
Highly recommeded for casual tmes, when you are in a hurry and want to play just a bit or, for that "in between big games" time.

2379893.review: Feeding Frenzy 2 Deluxe by PopCap Games is a very simple concept that becomes suprisingly challenging as the game wears on.  The basic premise is you begin as a small fish and must eat like sized or smaller fish until you grow big enough to eat the next largest fish.  The games graphics are bright and cheerful, the music appropriate and not aggravating, and the scoring screens even offer a little bit of fun information about fish.  While this game would be perfect for kids, the gameplay is brisk enough to be enjoyed by adults as well.  My only minor concerns with the game are the lack of Steam Overlay support, and a no Vysync option, which for high end systems may lead to some minor graphic tearing.  Altogether though, the game is fun and inexpensive and well worth your gaming dollar.

1504510.review: Супер игрушка -легкая, красивая, затягивающая. Один из лучших представителей своего жанра :)

2417652.review: This is one of those games in which it doesn't require to much skill but is a  lot of fun.  One of the things I most enjoyed about this game, is that because of how entertianing it is, time flew by.  I have yet to complete time attack, but if you want something that isn't so serious, I suggest this game right here. It even has neat little facts about fishies! ^-^
